description: Primes p such that x^13 = 2 has no solution mod p.
comments: Complement of A049545 relative to A000040.Presumably this is the same as Primes congruent to 1 mod 13. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 11 2008The smallest counterexample is 4421: 4421 == 1 (mod 13), but 162^13 == 2 (mod 4421), therefore this prime is not in the sequence. - _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 12 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range[PrimePi[5000]]], ! MemberQ[PowerMod[Range[#], 13, #], Mod[2, #]] &] (* _T. D. Noe_, Sep 12 2012 *)ok[p_]:= Reduce[Mod[x^13 - 2, p] == 0, x, Integers] == False; Select[Prime[Range[600]], ok] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 20 2012  *)
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(4500) | forall{x: x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^13 ne 2}]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 12 2012
author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jan 21 2001
